title: 15 Popular Nordstrom Shoes For Every Winter Occasion
description: Between the drop in temperature and the occasional rainy or snowy commute, winter is a convenient excuse to add some fresh shoes to the rotation, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into for everything from holiday parties to gym workouts. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, boots, comfortable heels, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a winter refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles.
author: Angela Elias
excerpt: We rounded up the best women's shoes money can buy at Nordstrom, from water-resistant boots and cute running shoes to chic loafers and more.
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.Between the drop in temperature and the occasional rainy or snowy commute, winter is a convenient excuse to add some fresh shoes to the rotation, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into for everything from holiday parties to gym workouts. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, boots, comfortable heels, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a winter refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles.02nordstrom.comHeeled MulesDolce Vita Kanika Pointed Toe Pump ($90, originally $135) The 3.5-inch heels on these pointed toe pumps are ideal if you want a height boost or to accentuate your legs in a cocktail dress. You can grab them in 10 different colors, some of which are on sale.04nordstrom.comNeutral SneakersAdidas Gazelle Sneaker ($100) A classic that will never go out of style, these Adidas Gazelle sneakers look fabulous with everything from dresses and jeans to sweatsuits with a trench. The pinkish tan hue is also a fantastic neutral if you want to deviate from black and gray.05PS Photography | Kyley WarrenMary Jane PumpsVagabond Shoemakers Ansie Mary Jane Pump ($105, originally $175) For Mary Janes with a slight edge, this pair fits the bill with its double straps, glossy finish, and chunky heel. We especially love them with sheer ankle socks, but you can also wear them without socks on warmer days. Our editor owns them and can't get over how comfortable they are. For more details and to see how she styles them, read our Vagabond Shoemakers Ansie Mary Jane Pump review. Editor quote: "Because the shoes are so comfortable, I feel confident wearing them to work events, coworking spaces, dinner dates, and even just long days outside of my house. They ooze a polished and preppy vibe that feels formal yet still playful; you can get away with wearing them to the office and straight to a cocktail party afterward." — Kyley Warren, assistant editor, Shopping06nordstrom.comCalf Hair BootiesSam Edelman Paige Bootie ($115, originally $170) Between the textured calf hair and leopard print, these booties can easily wake up an all-black outfit or mix with other classic prints, like plaid and pinstripes. The squared toe gives them a bit of modern edge while the stacked block heel makes them comfortable enough to wear to the office.07nordstrom.comMary Jane FlatsDolce Vita Reyes Mary Jane ($120) It seems like red Mary Jane flats are everywhere right now, and this pair is raking in tons of positive reviews. Shoppers are loving how comfortable the leather is and appreciate the modern take of the square toe that reveals just a hint of toe cleavage.11nordstrom.comRunning SneakersCloudtilt Athletic Sneaker ($160) If you're looking for a running shoe that has major cushioning with a lightweight sole, these Cloudtilt sneakers are definitely worth trying. They offer a soft landing, whether you're going for a run, walking, or enjoying a step class. Grab them in this smoky gray and tan palette, or in three other color combinations.12nordstrom.comPatent LoafersCoach Leah Platform Loafers ($195) The patent leather and chunky platform sole on these loafers is a refreshing twist on a classic that you can wear for years. If patent leather isn't your thing, you can choose from several other styles.13nordstrom.comWestern BootiesMiz Mooz Carlitos Western Bootie ($200) For a soft entry into the Western aesthetic, you can't go wrong with this bootie. It has a stacked heel, tonal stitching, and ankle height. It comes in eight colors, ranging from neutrals to bold colors, but we love this Brandy hue.14nordstrom.comKnee-High BootsSam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200) Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in several different leather options, as well as this gorgeous suede styles.15nordstrom.comPleated BootiesNeil J. Rodgers Plisse Ankle Boots ($895) Neil J. Rodgers just became available at Nordstrom, and we're eyeing these pleated ankle boots. The shape and color is versatile enough to be worn with practically anything, but the individually hand-folded pleats crafted from soft Italian leather also make a statement. They're selling quickly, so snag them in your size before they're gone!-Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Between the drop in temperature and the occasional rainy or snowy commute, winter is a convenient excuse to add some fresh shoes to the rotation, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into for everything from holiday parties to gym workouts. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, boots, comfortable heels, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a winter refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles.

02

Heeled Mules

Dolce Vita Kanika Pointed Toe Pump ($90, originally $135)

The 3.5-inch heels on these pointed toe pumps are ideal if you want a height boost or to accentuate your legs in a cocktail dress. You can grab them in 10 different colors, some of which are on sale.

04

Neutral Sneakers

Adidas Gazelle Sneaker ($100)

A classic that will never go out of style, these Adidas Gazelle sneakers look fabulous with everything from dresses and jeans to sweatsuits with a trench. The pinkish tan hue is also a fantastic neutral if you want to deviate from black and gray.

05

Mary Jane Pumps

Vagabond Shoemakers Ansie Mary Jane Pump ($105, originally $175)

For Mary Janes with a slight edge, this pair fits the bill with its double straps, glossy finish, and chunky heel. We especially love them with sheer ankle socks, but you can also wear them without socks on warmer days. Our editor owns them and can't get over how comfortable they are. For more details and to see how she styles them, read our Vagabond Shoemakers Ansie Mary Jane Pump review.

Editor quote: "Because the shoes are so comfortable, I feel confident wearing them to work events, coworking spaces, dinner dates, and even just long days outside of my house. They ooze a polished and preppy vibe that feels formal yet still playful; you can get away with wearing them to the office and straight to a cocktail party afterward." — Kyley Warren, assistant editor, Shopping

06

Calf Hair Booties

Sam Edelman Paige Bootie ($115, originally $170)

Between the textured calf hair and leopard print, these booties can easily wake up an all-black outfit or mix with other classic prints, like plaid and pinstripes. The squared toe gives them a bit of modern edge while the stacked block heel makes them comfortable enough to wear to the office.

07

Mary Jane Flats

Dolce Vita Reyes Mary Jane ($120)

It seems like red Mary Jane flats are everywhere right now, and this pair is raking in tons of positive reviews. Shoppers are loving how comfortable the leather is and appreciate the modern take of the square toe that reveals just a hint of toe cleavage.

11

Running Sneakers

Cloudtilt Athletic Sneaker ($160)

If you're looking for a running shoe that has major cushioning with a lightweight sole, these Cloudtilt sneakers are definitely worth trying. They offer a soft landing, whether you're going for a run, walking, or enjoying a step class. Grab them in this smoky gray and tan palette, or in three other color combinations.

12

Patent Loafers

Coach Leah Platform Loafers ($195)

The patent leather and chunky platform sole on these loafers is a refreshing twist on a classic that you can wear for years. If patent leather isn't your thing, you can choose from several other styles.

13

Western Booties

Miz Mooz Carlitos Western Bootie ($200)

For a soft entry into the Western aesthetic, you can't go wrong with this bootie. It has a stacked heel, tonal stitching, and ankle height. It comes in eight colors, ranging from neutrals to bold colors, but we love this Brandy hue.

14

Knee-High Boots

Sam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200)

Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in several different leather options, as well as this gorgeous suede styles.

15

Pleated Booties

Neil J. Rodgers Plisse Ankle Boots ($895)

Neil J. Rodgers just became available at Nordstrom, and we're eyeing these pleated ankle boots. The shape and color is versatile enough to be worn with practically anything, but the individually hand-folded pleats crafted from soft Italian leather also make a statement. They're selling quickly, so snag them in your size before they're gone!

Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
